snippet: “Even those newly minted as middle class enjoy a standard of living that is modest by Western norms,” the report pointed out.
abstract: Pew Research Center report on global incomes find 71 percent of world population meets current definition of poor or low-income; research affirms that those who escape poverty still teeter on its edge and findings are likely to add to policy debates over income inequality.
lead_paragraph: “Even those newly minted as middle class enjoy a standard of living that is modest by Western norms,” the report pointed out.

headline.main: Study Finds Low Incomes Constrain Half of World
headline.print_headline: Study Finds Low Incomes Constrain Half of World
